caseTitle: IN THE MATTER OF THE NATIVE ADMINISTRATION ORDINANCE AND IN THE MATTER OF THE NATIVE TRIBUNAL OF ADONTENHENE OF AKWAPHI, ABURI AND IN THE MATTER OF SUITS BARIM
summary: This 1941 West African Court of Appeal decision in Accra addressed an appeal brought under section 3(2) of the West African Court of Appeal Ordinance. The court held that section 3(2) applies exclusively to matrimonial matters, and since the case before it did not concern matrimonial issues, the appeal was not maintainable. The appeal was consequently struck out with costs assessed at Â£18 0s 6d. The case arose from a dispute involving the Native Tribunal of Adontenhene of Akwaphi, Aburi, under the Native Administration Ordinance.
citations: West African Court of Appeal Ordinance (Cap. 5)
rationaleHighlights: Section 3(2) applies only to matrimonial matters
The present case was not matrimonial in nature
Appeal not maintainable under the Ordinance
confidenceNotes: High confidence in factual accuracy based on clear judicial statement regarding jurisdictional limits of section 3(2); primary source appears authentic with proper court header and date.
